column1: Link SubService option is incorrectly visible on Create Zone Type screen
column23:
*Description:*
In the Create Zone Type screen, the “Link SubService” option appears in the left navigation panel.
This option should NOT be visible as per Figma.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
Login to BZMS Backend Officer Portal as BZ Registration Officer.
Navigate to Create → Create Zone Type.
Open any Zone Type record.
Observe the left-side navigation panel.

*Test Data:*

Username: BZMS Officer Test 2

Password: Zatca@123

 

*Actual Result:*
The “Link SubService” menu item is displayed under Details.

!image-2025-12-21-10-58-21-632.png|width=508,height=225!


*Expected Result:*
The “Link SubService” option should NOT be displayed anywhere as per Figma.
This option should be completely removed from UI.

!image-2025-12-21-10-57-42-956.png|width=324,height=222!
column353: 22/Dec/25 7:27 AM;anssharma-c;This is as per the story TDD-11015. ;;;

column1: Freeze Component Control Shows as "Toggle" instead of "Freeze Component"
column23:
*Steps To Reproduce:*

1.Login as BZMS Officer

2.Go to Amend Component Section

3.Observe Toggle label as “Toggle” instead of “Freeze Component”

Toggle control should show “Freeze Component” as label (as per figma)

*Actual Behavior*

column1: Test Data Needed to test Create Zone Profile/Amend Zone Profile flow for Zone Type not licensed by ZATCA Scenario
column23:
*Description:*

Test data is missing for Zone type which is not licensed by ZATCA to test the Create and Amend Zone Profile Flow as an Officer.

Tried with Type-Economic Zone as communicated by [~anssharma-c] but still able to see Zone Operator section enabled 

Also Tried to create a sample Zone type and unchecked the box 'This is Licensed by ZATCA' at the time of creation and tried with this. But still able to see Operator Section displayed.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Login as BZMS Officer
 # Create/Amend Zone  Profile
 # Enter Zone type which is not licensed by ZATCA (Tried all in the dropdown)
 # Observe the Zone Operation Section

*Actual Result:* Zone Operator Section Visible 

*Expected Result:* Zone Operator Section should be disabled as per User story

column1: More Information Required functionality for Create/Amend Zone Profile Functionality Issues Observed
column23:
*Description:*  

*Create Zone Profile:*  
More Information Required by Supervisor Functionality Working Fine. However, a minor UI issue is observed where Add Zone Profile is present Twice on the page  

*Amend Zone Profile:* 

When Officer is submitting the Amend Zone profile request after supervisor requests for more Information and re-submit, an error message is displayed. 

  
*Steps to reproduce - Create Zone Profile:*  
1. Login to the BZMS officer (Backend portal) as a BZMS officer   
2. Create a Zone Profile request as officer and select more info required as Supervisor  
3. Observe the label beside the Go option. 
 
*Steps to reproduce – Amend Zone Profile:* 

1. Login to the BZMS officer (Backend portal) as a BZMS officer   
2. Create a Zone Profile request as officer and approve as supervisor 
3. Amend the respective Zone Profile as Officer and click on More Info Required as Supervisor 
4. Submit the Amend request and observe the error message   
    
*Actual result:*

For Create zone Profile -> the Label under the Assignments is repeated twice as ‘Add new zone profile – Add new zone profile’ 
For Amend Zone Profile -> After submitting the amend request where supervisor requested for more info, Failed error message is displayed   
*Expected result:*

For Create Zone Profile -> the text should be appearing once  
For Amend Zone Profile -> After submitting the amend request where supervisor requested for more info, it should get submitted.

column1: Create Zone Profile/Amend Zone Profile - Map Components functionality checkbox is not working as expected
column23:
*Description:*

*Create Zone Profile – Map components checkbox functionality*  
Once the Officer add the necessary details of zone name, type, operator details, contact and address details and proceeds with map components, when officer first clicks on the checkbox, he will be able to see the component details but we he again uncheck and try to go to next it is throwing error messaged to fill out mandatory details  

*Amend Zone Profile – Map Components checkbox Functionality*  
Once the Officer submits the Create zone Profile request and gets it approved by supervisor, Officer proceeds with amendment of the respective request. But while amending, the map components checkbox itself is not present as per figma  

 
*Steps to reproduce – Create zone Profile*  
1. Login to the BZMS (backend) as an Officer  
2. Click on Create Zone Profile  
3. Add all the mandatory details  
4. Select the check box under Map Components section 
5. Deselect the checkbox 
6. Click on next  
7. Observe the error messages being displayed  

*Steps to reproduce – Create zone Profile*  
1. Login to the BZMS (backend) as an Officer  
2. Click on Create Zone Profile and submit and Approve the same as supervisor  
3. Login as Officer  
4. Click on Amend Zone Profile Option -> Add necessary details  
5. click on next  
6. Observe the Map Components page  

 
*Actual result:*

 ** For Create Zone Profile -> Officer is not able to submit the request when he uncheck the map components checkbox for the second time after checking it at first attempt 
For Amend Zone Profile -> Map Components checkbox is missing  

*Expected Result:*

For Create Zone Profile -> whenever the check box is being unchecked, no errors should be shown, and Officer should be able to proceed with request submission 
For Amend Zone Profile -> Map Components Checkbox should be present as per Figma

column1: In Create Component screen, Basic Details section does not match Figma – missing fields, incorrect fields and incorrect labels
column23:
h5. *Description:*
h5. In the Add Component screen, the Basic Details section in the actual application does not match the  Figma design.

Several discrepancies have been observed including missing mandatory fields, incorrect field names, additional unwanted fields, and missing helper text.As per Figma, the Basic Details section must contain the following fields:
 * Type‑code/ID*
 * Component title*
 * Description

h5. However, the actual screen displays incorrect field such as Building Name and incorrect labels.{*}Steps to Reproduce:{*}
 # Login to the BZMS backend officer portal.
 # Navigate to Create → Create Component.
 # Observe the Basic Details section and compare it with the Figma design.

h3. *Actual Result:*
h5. The Basic Details section shows the following issues:
 * “Component title” field is missing.
 * An incorrect field “Building Name” is displayed (not part of Figma).
 * Field labels do not match Figma:
 ** “Component type/Code ID” instead of “Type‑code/ID”
 ** “Component Description” instead of “Description"
 * !image-2025-12-17-18-10-05-229.png|width=548,height=242!

----
h3. Expected Result:
h5. The Basic Details section should match the Figma design and include:
 * 
h5. Correct fields: Type‑code/ID*, Component title*, Description

 * 
h5. No additional or incorrect fields (e.g., Building Name)

 * 
h5. Correct field labels matching Figma terminology

!image-2025-12-17-18-14-00-873.png|width=594,height=198!
column354: 18/Dec/25 7:50 PM;ybaba-c;Reviewed the Create components Basic Details Form. Observed that Type-code/ID and Description is Corrected. But building name is still present instead of Component Title. Reopening the issue ;;;
column356:
21/Dec/25 10:01 AM;anssharma-c;HEllo [~ybaba-c] this is developed as per story 5. BZ Registration Officer enters example details such as: 
o Building Name: “Main Storage Building” 
o Child Component: “Warehouse A” under the Main Storage Building 
• 
o Sub-Component: “Shelf A1” under Warehouse A 



 

Building name is part of the story and design also reflects the same. ;;;

column1: HS Code is not displayed on the Approval screen after performing an amendment in the Master UOM record.
column23:
+*Description:*+
When amending a Master UOM, the user manually enters the *HS Code* and submits the amendment request. The request then moves to the *BZ Supervisor* for approval.
However, when the Supervisor opens the request and views the amendment details, the {*}HS Code value does not appear{*}. The field is shown as blank, even though the user had entered it during the amendment.
 
+*Steps to reproduce:*+
 # Login to BZMS Officer Backend portal as BZ Registration Officer.
 # Click on Create button then select Amend Master UOM option.
 # Select the Master UOM from the displayed list for which you want to perform amend operation. and click on Submit.
 # Enter the the HS code in amendment screen.
 # Click on 'Submit' button.
 # Once the request is created it will be routed to BZ Supervisor for the approval.
 # Now Login to BZMS Officer Backend portal as BZ Supervisor.
 # Open the amendment request created in Step6.
 # Observe the HS code details 

+*Actual Result:*+

The HS Code field is blank on the Approval screen.
The value entered during amendment is not displayed to the Supervisor.

!image-2025-12-16-20-17-35-770.png|width=541,height=243!

+*Expected Result:*+ 
The HS Code entered during amendment should be displayed correctly on the Supervisor’s Approval screen.
column353:
18/Dec/25 8:15 PM;ybaba-c;Retested the Issue - HS code manually entered is visible to the supervisor for the Amend UOM Request but not in the Create UOM Request for the same Request BUOM-69 and same HS code 930111000000

Refer the Attachments for the Screenshots;;;
column354:
21/Dec/25 9:20 AM;anssharma-c;Requesting to test with new cases.

RCA: Coding;;;

column1: Freeze toggle present in the details section for the Zone details and added Operators flow for both Officer and Supervisor Login
column23:
*Description:* ** 
Once the Registered BZ Registration Officer amends a zone profile and submits the amendment request the Freeze zone toggle is visible under details section  
 
*Steps to reproduce* *:*
1. Login to the BZMS officer (Backend portal) as a BZMS officer 
2. Click on the create button in the home page 
3. Select Amend zone profile option->Select any eligible request for amendment 
4. Make required changes in the form and submit 
5. Observe the freeze toggle under details section 
7. Login as Supervisor->Approve the request->Observe the details section 
 
{*}Actual result{*}*:* The Freeze this zone Toggle is visible under Details section 
*Expected result:* The status should be changed as submitted and freeze this zone Toggle should not be visible under Details section

column1: Operator Name, Coordinator Last Name, and Mobile Number Missing in Request Details Page
column23:
h4. *Description:*

After editing component operator details and submitting changes, the *Request Details* page does not display the following fields:
 * *Operator Name*
 * *Coordinator Last Name*
 * *Coordinator Mobile Number*

These fields appear blank.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

1.Navigate to View Details → Edit Profile → Operator Details.
2.Select an Operator Name.
3.Change Coordinator Details.
4.Click Submit.
5.Go to View Request → Request Details Page.
6.Observe that:

Operator Name is missing.
Coordinator Last Name and Mobile Number are blank.

*Expected Result:*
The Request Details page should display Operator Name, Coordinator Last Name and
Coordinator Mobile Number correctly.

*Actual Result:*
Operator Name is missing.
Coordinator Last Name and Mobile Number are blank.

column23:

4.Observe the field label for broker information.
h3. *Expected Result:*

Field label should match the Figma design:
*Broker Name / License Number.*

 
h3. *Actual Result:*

Field label in the implemented UI shows:
*Broker Name / License Number / Broker License Number*

column23:

 # Navigate to *HS Code Mapping* section.

2.    Navigate: Account Management → Component Operator Access Account. 
3.    Select any component operator. 
4.    Attempt to amend authorization or freeze/unfreeze the account.

column1: Notification not triggered after Operator account request is approved by Bonded Zone officer.
column23:
*Notification not triggered for both LocalTrader and ForeignTrader.*

*Expected Behavior:*
 * When an Operator account request is approved by the Bonded Zone officer (via backend), the system should trigger a notification to the Operator confirming approval.

*Actual Behavior:*
 * Operator account is created successfully through the front end and approved by the Bonded Zone officer from the backend, but *no notification is triggered* to the Operator.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Log in to BZMS portal and create an Operator account request from the front end.
 # Submit the request successfully.
 # Approve the request from the backend as Bonded Zone officer.
 # Check for notification (email/SMS/in-app).
 # Observe that no notification is triggered.

column1: Rejection flow of Authorization request of Local trader / Foreign trader not working as expected. No text box to enter rejection reason
column23:
+*Description:*+ 
Text box for rejection reason is not being displayed. Directly the request is being rejected. And Rejection status is marked in green, no tab for rejection reason displayed. 

+*Steps to reproduce*+ 
1. Login to the BZMS as an Foreign trader/local trader 
2. Click on Zone Profile Management -> Add Zone Profile 
3. Under bonded zone details relevant Select Zone profile and components and enter authorization start and end date  
4. Click on next and in the summary, page click on submit  
5. Login as Operator 
6. Click on Incoming Request 
7. Search for the created Application -> view details -> Take action -> Reject Request  
8. Observe the action being performed -> directly being rejected  
  

*Actual result:* Request being rejected without asking for reason. Rejected status marked as green 


+*Expected result:*+ A message box should be displayed to enter the rejection reason and foreign trader must be able to see the rejection reason in view details. Rejection reason must be displayed instead of Request details  

*Note:* Issue common for both Foreign trader and local trader
column353: 21/Dec/25 8:37 AM;ybaba-c;Retested the Issue - A message box is displayed to enter rejection reason. This issue is fixed for both Local Trader and Foreign Trader  !RejectionMessageBox_Fixed.png|width=608,height=226!;;;
column354:
21/Dec/25 8:37 AM;ybaba-c;Reopening the issue because the Rejected status is marked as green 
!RejectionStatusMarkedGreen_TobeFixed.png|width=1313,height=452!;;;

column1: Error message “Zone Code cannot be empty” displayed when Local Trader creates a new Zone Profile, even though Zone Profile is already mapped.

*Actual Behavior:*

_“Zone Code cannot be empty”_
 * This occurs even though the Zone Profile is already mapped.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Log in to BZMS portal.
 # Navigate to *Account Management* section.
 # Locate the service option for {*}Request to be Operator{*}.
 # Enter all required details and ensure Zone Profile is mapped.
 # Submit the request.
 # Observe error message: “Zone Code cannot be empty”.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

 # Initiate request for Operator account.
 # Navigate to Account Management > Resister as Operator.
 # Observe the displayed licensing authority for Foreign Trader.

column1: “Go To Dashboard” post registration redirects incorrectly / logs out after creating Zone Profile
column23:
Description 
•    Expected: After registration or successful login, clicking Go To Dashboard should route the operator to the Zone Profile Management dashboard with options to create/manage zone profiles. 
•    Actual: Clicking Go To Dashboard results in wrong redirection (unexpected page) or forced logout. 

Steps to reproduce 
1.    Register as a new BZ Operator (or use newly created operator account). 
2.    Create zone profile with all necessary details.

3. On the confirmation page, click Go To Dashboard.

4.    Observe navigation result: page not Zone Profile dashboard OR session ends/logs out.
